bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on June 25, 2004. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon licensee request, to extend the time period during which the licensee is required to commence construction of a hydroelectric project in Alaska for three consecutive two-year periods beyond the date that is four years after the date of issuance of the license.
